Created an attachment (id=4760)
Config detail report

This error indicates that the JDT wizard that next would create is not an 
instance of INewWizard. However I have looked through the code and don't see 
anywhere where there are changing the wizard after the first page.

Reassigning to JDT for investigation.
Jeff, which version are you using. This got fix for 2.1 final.

I am using 2.1.  The attached config report should verify that.  However, based
on your note I re-installed the 2.1 zip file clean and tried the function and it
works.

The only explaination I have is that when I installed the 2.1 zip it was over
the top of a 2.1 M build and there was some refactoring of jar files that
happen, so that an old class was picked up first.  

It looks like I did not do something correctly, however I'm not sure wat it is.


** somewhat off topic **
Which leads me to a general question or two...  Is there a recommended practice
to install / upgrade?    If I do a clean install, is there a way to get my
existing config data to go?  I installed over the top of my install to preserve
my config data.

All the config data is stored in the workspace. So if your workspace resides 
outside the installation (you can do this by using -data argument for the 
eclipse executable) you can always install eclipse as a fresh copy.

Closing PR since problem got fixed for 2.1
